headline: Citizens Financial Group (CFG) valuation after earnings beat and prime lending rate cut prompts closer investor review
summary: Citizens Financial Group (CFG) has had an eventful stretch, pairing a narrow earnings and revenue beat with a cut in its prime lending rate to 6.75%, a move that directly shapes borrowing demand. See our latest analysis for Citizens Financial Group. The market seems to be warming to that mix of solid execution and a more competitive lending stance. A 30 day share price return of 11.67 percent supports a year to date share price gain of 34.08 percent and a five year total shareholder return...

headline: Here Are Thursday’s Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: American Eagle Outfitters, Ferrari, Intuitive Surgical, Roku, PayPal, Synopsis, Visa, and More
summary: Pre-Market Stock Futures: Futures are trading lower after a big rate-cut rally on Wednesday was sideswiped by Oracle’s disappointing earnings after the bell yesterday. The Federal Reserve’s 25-basis-point rate cut, as expected, put the benchmark rate at 3.50%-3.75%. The third consecutive cut lowered rates to their lowest level since late 2022, to help support a ... headline: Is It Too Late to Consider Citizens Financial Group After Its 34% 2025 Rally?
summary: Wondering if Citizens Financial Group is still a smart buy at today’s price, or if the easy money has already been made? In this article we break down what the market might be missing in its valuation. After climbing to around $58.46, the stock is up 5.0% over the last week, 11.7% over the past month, and 34.1% year to date, adding to a 31.3% gain over the last year and more than doubling over five years. These moves have come alongside a steady stream of headlines around balance sheet...
